snippet: Eliot Spitzer, who plans to finance his campaign for New York City comptroller using his family’s wealth, disclosed 2012 earnings of $4.2 million
abstract: Eliot Spitzer, who plans to finance his campaign for New York City comptroller using his family’s wealth, discloses that he earned more than $4.2 million in 2012 and paid about $2.1 million in federal, state and city taxes; campaign releases figures after his Democratic opponent Scott M Stringer released his tax returns and called on Spitzer to do the same.
lead_paragraph: Eliot Spitzer, who plans to finance his campaign for New York City comptroller using his family’s wealth, disclosed 2012 earnings of $4.2 million

headline.main: Spitzer Reveals Income, but Not the Tax Returns a Rival Sought
headline.print_headline: Spitzer Reveals Income, but Stringer Wants His Tax Returns
